DataElement.preferredName: Brachytherapy First Reference Point Administered Total Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the total dose in cGY of brachytherapy treatment given to the first reference point.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A specified location to which measurements are referred._Given.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A specified location to which measurements are referred.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A specified location to which measurements are referred.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 10/2010 sw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
